intro: Lacistema pubescens, commonly known as the hairy lacistema, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and heart-shaped leaves. It produces showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in summer. Lacistema pubescens is often found in moist, well-drained soils in woodland or open areas.
